com.sri.kernel
Class Logger

java.lang.Object
  java.io.OutputStream
      java.io.FilterOutputStream
          java.io.PrintStream
              com.sri.kernel.Logger
public class Logger
extends java.io.PrintStream

This is the core logging class for all components created or loaded by the SR4 Kernel. It provides a layer to a PrintStream allowing functionality of logging levels, which are used to suppress unimportant messages, and adds a timestamp to all output. It handles creating and managing the underlying files.

There are 4 constructors. two of which specify a path for the log file, and the other two rely on a previous instantiation of the log to set the path. Then one of each two allows the level to be set, or use the default LOG_ERROR level. The path should only be set by the kernel. All other created logs, for instance logs created by modules should NOT set the path itself. See the specific constructor description for the purpose of each constructor and the meanings of each argument.

All logs require two pieces of information: a generic log name, and a file name. This generic log name is made to identify the log. The file name is the name of the file within the logging directory.

Each time a log is created a start message will be displayed like this: 

    2004-03-31 10:3:6 - +++++++++ SR4 Kernel Log Started +++++++++
Also, when a log is stopped, a similar message will be outputted like this: 
    2004-03-31 10:5:6 - ========= SR4 Kernel Log Stopped =========

There are currently 6 levels of logging: Trace, Debug, Message, Warn, Error, and Fatal. Each level increases in severity, and is more likely to be logged. If for instance, the current log level was Error and a Message level was logged, it would not be printed. However, if a Fatal level was logged it would be printed. There are several convenience functions for outputting a desired log level.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Constructor Detail

Logger

public Logger(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String path,
              java.lang.String fname)
Creates a log with the specified name, path, and file name. For use by SR4Kernel only!

Parameters:
name - The generic human-readable name.
path - The root path for the log files. This path will be used for all newly create Loggers.
fname - The name of the file within the root path.

Logger

public Logger(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String path,
              java.lang.String fname,
              int level)
Creates a log with the specified name, path, file name, and level. For use by SR4Kernel only!

Parameters:
name - The generic human-readable name.
path - The root path for the log files. This path will be used for all newly create Loggers.
fname - The name of the file within the root path.
level - The log level. See LOG_ constants for available log levels

Logger

public Logger(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String fname)
Creates a log with the specified name and file name. Used to create a new log file using the current log path.

Parameters:
name - The generic human-readable name.
fname - The name of the file within the root path.

Logger

public Logger(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String fname,
              int level)
Creates a log with the specified name, file name, and level. Used to create a new log file using the current log path with the specified logging level.

Parameters:
name - The generic human-readable name.
fname - The name of the file within the root path.
level - The log level. See LOG_ constants for available log levels

setLevel

public void setLevel(int level)
Sets the current logging level.

Parameters:
level - The level to set the logging, as specified by LOG_ contsants.

getLevel

public int getLevel()
Returns the current logging level.

Returns:
The current logging level, as specified by LOG_ constants

log

public void log(int level,
                java.lang.String s)
Logs the string [s] with the level [level]. If the level is equal or higher than the current logging level, it will be logged.

Parameters:
level - The desired level at which to log.
s - The string to log.

println

public void println(java.lang.String s)
Overrides the underlying PrintStreams println function. No logging level is used.

Parameters:
s - The string to log.

trace

Logs the string [s] at level LOG_TRACE. Shortcut to log(LOG_TRACE, s);

Parameters:
s - The string to log.
